title: @Riot, remember what you said when you nerfed Sejuani and Cinderhulk?
body:
If I remember correctly, I recall someone from Riot saying that you guys like to "rotate popular champions." 

So why has Ahri been a consistent popular pick since release? Why is Zed buffed the moment he falls out of the meta? Why is Caitlyn allowed to be in her current oppressive state for so long?

I'm just wondering if these are your exceptions to this rule, or if I should just keep quiet about this inconsistency like everyone else is.

EDIT: I've seen claims of 'circle-jerking' and the like going around here quite a bit. I'm not sure how people are taking this thread's meaning, but I just wanted a Rioter from the gameplay team to tell me what's going on so we can put this issue to rest.

replies.body:
This has been a problem practically since the beginning, but it wasn't nearly this terrible, and it's only escalated since they've been focusing so much into their precious esports. I don't mind them wanting to make the game popular, but it wasn't tv shows & internet streams that made the game popular in the first place. It was because it was felt fair & balanced, and when some champion was noticeably under performing or clearly abusive, they quickly brought them into line; within a couple weeks, not several months, and it was where it counted in the champion kit to prevent them from drifting into that direction again. There were a few exceptions that took longer, but the point is riot didn't play favorites & they didn't drag their feet about it. This is primarily what kept it fun, that they payed attention to the community to see what was fair; and it's how they grew up so fast to begin with.

Any old time gamer here can tell you, the toxicity of the community has significantly increased as they started trying to shove the game as a televised competitive sport. The 'strategic diversity' & 'counter-play' were blatant lies to calm the masses from long outstanding frustrating gameplay; looking at the numbers through out the patch notes shows it clearly. The favoritism for abusive champions getting noticeable compensation whenever they get any nerf, yet the more fair ones only get a slight positive tweak if any. Not to mention the repeated hand-waves for the game not going downhill; despite the obvious one sided balancing act and blind eye to the venomous parts of the population (tribunal was never updated & outright replaced by an inefficient bot). 

In the past few years, I've hardly played 1/10th what I used to the year it came out. Tired of the game as a concept in general? Not really, I've still got a handful of games well over a decade old I still play for having good gameplay & stories. It's clearly not the game it used to be, whether another company had a hand in it or not, I'm unsure; but I'm betting, that if they don't get their act together to start fixing it with the community, it'll fall apart in humiliation.

The favoritism has grown more and more bold lately. Back a few years ago they were making up excuses like "buffing everyone up to the Renekton bar" when he was dominating top lane by himself or removing the {{champion:64}} rework from the PBE because "it didn't quite hit the mark". You wanna know what rework didn't hit the mark but was left to happen anyway because he wasn't as popular as Lee Sin?

{{champion:82}} 

Nowadays the favoritism is almost blatant. Flashy champions like {{champion:238}}  always seem to get compensation buffs when they get nerfed to keep them strong but in a slightly different way. Meanwhile, less flashy champions get nerfed down and are left there for extended periods of time/until they get reworked.

And even then sometimes the rework is just as bad, right {{champion:72}} ? Maybe if the crystal scorpion had two instant gapclosers, long range wave clear, and an ult that deleted an enemy champion he'd have gotten the attention he deserved. That would never happen to someone like {{champion:103}} because Riot actually takes care when handling them.

And of course there's the classic "counterargument" that those favored champs are treated that way because they're more popular. Well, no shit. Those champs are popular because Riot keeps them strong most of the time, so more people feel safe maining them because they know Riot most likely won't dumpster them. You can't get that same unspoken guarantee with a champion like {{champion:112}} or {{champion:37}}.

It's hard to take you seriously when you call Caitlyn oppressive. Literally her only issue is that she can chain-root by lying her traps under an enemy who has already been CCd. She has one of the weakest all-in in the game and her poke and traps are easily avoidable. She has consistently had a low or average winrate. I don't recall her being top tier in years.

Cait is oppressive. 

If the person playing cait isn't a complete idiot, defensive  traps alone win engagements for your team, whether its an offensive push on a tower or defending. 

Cait's entire issue is that there is no answer to her traps. Maybe if minions set them off like every other one, but currently they **are** a problem.

They give her a slight zoning power like Azir, Taliyah, and a dozen other zone control champions. The difference is that against Cait you just walk around her traps... Like I said, besides the trap-chaining which gives her immediate roots, Cait is rather weak. She's only usable right now because all the other ADCs who have been absolutely busted have been nerfed or had core items nerfed. That's how it's been since her release. Caitlyn is weak but consistent so when other ADCs are weak she comes out to play, even then she's not oppressive.

That's not a 'slight zoning power'. 

Its 5 persistent (10+ seconds) zoning hard CC+steroids/animation cancels. Something none of the champions you attempted to compare have in their kit. Nothing else in her kit is really an issue. Its just the new way the traps benefit her and can be quickly set up without any answer outside of dying/being forced to recall unless you're massively ahead. Waiting them out isn't realistic. 

If you aren't an idiot, you'll properly space your traps in a way that forces them to either eat the traps or eat every skillshot on your team, not to mention the traps are preventing any reliable follow-up from their team. 

Cait is not rather weak. You'd have to be an idiot to believe that.

Also, you have it backwards. Cait was considered the opposite of consistent in the past because she had no steroid. With Runaan's not sucking anymore and her trap/net, that's no longer an issue.

And that's simple: Zed's play pattern is ideal for his class. Yea, people whine about Zed ulting straight to them and beating them up, but he has a window where he's screaming to the heavens "I'M GOING TO KILL YOUR TEAMMATE NOW", and that gives everyone a solid second to prepare to deal with him. It isn't like Katarina or Talon who just blink to you and delete your coding from the game. Everyone's whining about QSS when they can just use their kit tools to lock down Zed before he has a chance to combo and beef up his ult damage. Same thing with Fizz in the sense that there's some sort of "thing" that occurs before the assassination part that slows him down from that toxic pattern of dying before you can even say "blink".

Compare this to Sona where, if she's strong, there's nothing you can do about it. You can't counter-play a play style based around passing around numbers from a distance all game, and her ult isn't the easiest to miss unless you're doing it from a decent range away or the enemy uses mobility options or high movement speed to dodge it. Since Sona's counter-play is low, they keep her in a comparatively weaker state than her peers and say "Use items to scale into a decent champion! :D :D :D". Apply this logic to everyone else with the same problem: Garen, Xin Zhao, Kayle, Nunu, so on and so forth.

Applying all this to Sejuani: She doesn't really *die* when she finally gets items, she does aoe damage with aoe cc, and she's kinda hard to shake off. After the Cinderhulk days, they'd rather have people in the meta that do more than "Stand next to me and drain my life away with Sunfire + Thorn passives while I can do literally 0 about it".
